I'm Jill Simpson from DEVA Training in Kilmarnock.
We help our clients communicate their message

12.text:
to customers, colleagues and others.
Great Communication is important in every

17.text: aspect of our daily lives and it's also true for our business lives. These are my 5 Top

23.text:
Tips for great business communication.
One. Shut up and listen. It's often been pointed

30.text:
out that we have two ears and one mouth for
a reason: by really listening we start to

35.text:
understand the others point of view, and when
we do, we're far better placed to put across

39.text:
our own position. Listening helps you to communicate
more effectively whether you are selling,

45.text:
managing or negotiating.
Two. Asking open questions will help you in

51.text:
developing this understanding: open questions
begin with How, When, Where, What, Why? Wherever

58.text:
possible, avoid interrupting: you might miss
out on a piece of information you'll find

63.text:
useful to understand the real issue, to strengthen
your case or to combat an objection.

69.text:
Three. Learn to be assertive: be clear about
what it is that you want the outcome of the

75.text:
conversation to be; check your own thinking
for hidden agendas, are you being honest in

80.text:
your communication? Ask for what you want.
If you have really listened to the other person,

87.text:
you can often propose a win-win solution
Four. Help people to trust you. If you can

93.text:
build rapport with the person you're talking
to you will get your point across. A smile,

98.text:
nodding in agreement and mild praise can go
a long way in getting people to like you.

103.text:
Make eye-contact, mirror their body language
and emphasis your similarities to help create

108.text:
a bond and build understanding. Learn to do
this in a natural way, it shouldn't be false

114.text:
Five. Hold back from making instant judgements.
It's all too easy to judge others or their

120.text:
motivation from their appearance, their accent,
or even based on our own mood of the moment.

126.text:
Approach every communication with an open
mind and you will often be pleasantly surprised

130.text:
at how easy it is to make a real connection.
I'm Jill Simpson from DEVA Training dot co

137.text:
dot uk and those are my 5 Top Tips to improve
your communication skills.
